question:
A spherical ball of radius 0.1 m and mass 0.5 kg is placed at the top of an inclined plane 8.52 meters long, angled at 15 degrees. The ball rolls down without slipping under gravity (g = 9.81 m/s²). There are 2 triangular obstacles (0.2 m high) placed at distances [7.77, 7.84] meters from the top of the slope.

At exactly t = 1.0 seconds after release, where is the center of the ball on the slope? Assume the ball stops instantly if its edge collides with the apex of a triangle.
Give a precise numeric answer in meters along the slope.
